fields.name: activeChannel
fields.description: The active Channel

fields.name: activeCustomer
fields.description: The active Customer

fields.name: activeOrder
fields.description:
The active Order. Will be `null` until an Order is created via `addItemToOrder`. Once an Order reaches the
state of `PaymentAuthorized` or `PaymentSettled`, then that Order is no longer considered "active" and this
query will once again return `null`.

fields.name: availableCountries
fields.description: An array of supported Countries

fields.name: collections
fields.description: A list of Collections available to the shop

fields.name: collection
fields.description: Returns a Collection either by its id or slug. If neither 'id' nor 'slug' is specified, an error will result.

fields.name: eligibleShippingMethods
fields.description: Returns a list of eligible shipping methods based on the current active Order

fields.name: eligiblePaymentMethods
fields.description: Returns a list of payment methods and their eligibility based on the current active Order

fields.name: facets
fields.description: A list of Facets available to the shop

fields.name: facet
fields.description: Returns a Facet by its id

fields.name: me
fields.description: Returns information about the current authenticated User

fields.name: nextOrderStates
fields.description: Returns the possible next states that the activeOrder can transition to

fields.name: order
fields.description:
Returns an Order based on the id. Note that in the Shop API, only orders belonging to the
currently-authenticated User may be queried.

fields.name: orderByCode
fields.description:
Returns an Order based on the order `code`. For guest Orders (i.e. Orders placed by non-authenticated Customers)
this query will only return the Order within 2 hours of the Order being placed. This allows an Order confirmation
screen to be shown immediately after completion of a guest checkout, yet prevents security risks of allowing
general anonymous access to Order data.

fields.name: product
fields.description: Get a Product either by id or slug. If neither 'id' nor 'slug' is specified, an error will result.

fields.name: products
fields.description: Get a list of Products

fields.name: search
fields.description: Search Products based on the criteria set by the `SearchInput`

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: addItemToOrder
fields.description: Adds an item to the order. If custom fields are defined on the OrderLine entity, a third argument 'customFields' will be available.

fields.name: removeOrderLine
fields.description: Remove an OrderLine from the Order

fields.name: removeAllOrderLines
fields.description: Remove all OrderLine from the Order

fields.name: adjustOrderLine
fields.description: Adjusts an OrderLine. If custom fields are defined on the OrderLine entity, a third argument 'customFields' of type `OrderLineCustomFieldsInput` will be available.

fields.name: applyCouponCode
fields.description: Applies the given coupon code to the active Order

fields.name: removeCouponCode
fields.description: Removes the given coupon code from the active Order

fields.name: transitionOrderToState
fields.description: Transitions an Order to a new state. Valid next states can be found by querying `nextOrderStates`

fields.name: setOrderShippingAddress
fields.description: Sets the shipping address for this order

fields.name: setOrderBillingAddress
fields.description: Sets the billing address for this order

fields.name: setOrderCustomFields
fields.description: Allows any custom fields to be set for the active order

fields.name: setOrderShippingMethod
fields.description: Sets the shipping method by id, which can be obtained with the `eligibleShippingMethods` query

fields.name: addPaymentToOrder
fields.description: Add a Payment to the Order

fields.name: setCustomerForOrder
fields.description: Set the Customer for the Order. Required only if the Customer is not currently logged in

fields.name: login
fields.description: Authenticates the user using the native authentication strategy. This mutation is an alias for `authenticate({ native: { ... }})`

fields.name: authenticate
fields.description: Authenticates the user using a named authentication strategy

fields.name: logout
fields.description: End the current authenticated session

fields.name: registerCustomerAccount
fields.description:
Register a Customer account with the given credentials. There are three possible registration flows:

_If `authOptions.requireVerification` is set to `true`:_

1. **The Customer is registered _with_ a password**. A verificationToken will be created (and typically emailed to the Customer). That
   verificationToken would then be passed to the `verifyCustomerAccount` mutation _without_ a password. The Customer is then
   verified and authenticated in one step.
2. **The Customer is registered _without_ a password**. A verificationToken will be created (and typically emailed to the Customer). That
   verificationToken would then be passed to the `verifyCustomerAccount` mutation _with_ the chosen password of the Customer. The Customer is then
   verified and authenticated in one step.

_If `authOptions.requireVerification` is set to `false`:_

3. The Customer _must_ be registered _with_ a password. No further action is needed - the Customer is able to authenticate immediately.

fields.name: refreshCustomerVerification
fields.description: Regenerate and send a verification token for a new Customer registration. Only applicable if `authOptions.requireVerification` is set to true.

fields.name: updateCustomer
fields.description: Update an existing Customer

fields.name: createCustomerAddress
fields.description: Create a new Customer Address

fields.name: updateCustomerAddress
fields.description: Update an existing Address

fields.name: deleteCustomerAddress
fields.description: Delete an existing Address

fields.name: verifyCustomerAccount
fields.description:
Verify a Customer email address with the token sent to that address. Only applicable if `authOptions.requireVerification` is set to true.

If the Customer was not registered with a password in the `registerCustomerAccount` mutation, the password _must_ be
provided here.

fields.name: updateCustomerPassword
fields.description: Update the password of the active Customer

fields.name: requestUpdateCustomerEmailAddress
fields.description:
Request to update the emailAddress of the active Customer. If `authOptions.requireVerification` is enabled
(as is the default), then the `identifierChangeToken` will be assigned to the current User and
a IdentifierChangeRequestEvent will be raised. This can then be used e.g. by the EmailPlugin to email
that verification token to the Customer, which is then used to verify the change of email address.

fields.name: updateCustomerEmailAddress
fields.description:
Confirm the update of the emailAddress with the provided token, which has been generated by the
`requestUpdateCustomerEmailAddress` mutation.

fields.name: requestPasswordReset
fields.description: Requests a password reset email to be sent

fields.name: resetPassword
fields.description: Resets a Customer's password based on the provided token

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

enumValues.name: NOT_DELETED
enumValues.description: Deletion did not take place, reason given in message

types.name: Permission

enumValues.name: Authenticated
enumValues.description: Authenticated means simply that the user is logged in

enumValues.name: SuperAdmin
enumValues.description: SuperAdmin has unrestricted access to all operations

enumValues.name: Owner
enumValues.description: Owner means the user owns this entity, e.g. a Customer's own Order

enumValues.name: Public
enumValues.description: Public means any unauthenticated user may perform the operation

enumValues.name: CreateCatalog
enumValues.description: Grants permission to create Products, Facets, Assets, Collections

enumValues.name: ReadCatalog
enumValues.description: Grants permission to read Products, Facets, Assets, Collections

enumValues.name: UpdateCatalog
enumValues.description: Grants permission to update Products, Facets, Assets, Collections

enumValues.name: DeleteCatalog
enumValues.description: Grants permission to delete Products, Facets, Assets, Collections

enumValues.name: CreateSettings
enumValues.description: Grants permission to create PaymentMethods, ShippingMethods, TaxCategories, TaxRates, Zones, Countries, System & GlobalSettings

enumValues.name: ReadSettings
enumValues.description: Grants permission to read PaymentMethods, ShippingMethods, TaxCategories, TaxRates, Zones, Countries, System & GlobalSettings

enumValues.name: UpdateSettings
enumValues.description: Grants permission to update PaymentMethods, ShippingMethods, TaxCategories, TaxRates, Zones, Countries, System & GlobalSettings

enumValues.name: DeleteSettings
enumValues.description: Grants permission to delete PaymentMethods, ShippingMethods, TaxCategories, TaxRates, Zones, Countries, System & GlobalSettings

types.name: NativeAuthStrategyError
types.description: Returned when attempting an operation that relies on the NativeAuthStrategy, if that strategy is not configured.

types.name: InvalidCredentialsError
types.description: Returned if the user authentication credentials are not valid

types.name: OrderStateTransitionError
types.description: Returned if there is an error in transitioning the Order state

types.name: EmailAddressConflictError
types.description: Returned when attempting to create a Customer with an email address already registered to an existing User.

types.name: OrderLimitError
types.description: Returned when the maximum order size limit has been reached.

types.name: NegativeQuantityError
types.description: Returned when attempting to set a negative OrderLine quantity.

types.name: InsufficientStockError
types.description: Returned when attempting to add more items to the Order than are available

types.name: CouponCodeInvalidError
types.description: Returned if the provided coupon code is invalid

types.name: CouponCodeExpiredError
types.description: Returned if the provided coupon code is invalid

types.name: CouponCodeLimitError
types.description: Returned if the provided coupon code is invalid

types.name: JSON
types.description: The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: DateTime
types.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

types.name: Upload
types.description: The `Upload` scalar type represents a file upload.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: A JSON stringified representation of the actual value

types.name: StringOperators
types.description: Operators for filtering on a String field

types.name: IDOperators
types.description: Operators for filtering on an ID field

types.name: BooleanOperators
types.description: Operators for filtering on a Boolean field

types.name: NumberOperators
types.description: Operators for filtering on a Int or Float field

types.name: DateOperators
types.description: Operators for filtering on a DateTime field

types.name: StringListOperators
types.description: Operators for filtering on a list of String fields

types.name: NumberListOperators
types.description: Operators for filtering on a list of Number fields

types.name: BooleanListOperators
types.description: Operators for filtering on a list of Boolean fields

types.name: IDListOperators
types.description: Operators for filtering on a list of ID fields

types.name: DateListOperators
types.description: Operators for filtering on a list of Date fields

types.name: FacetValueFilterInput
types.description:
Used to construct boolean expressions for filtering search results
by FacetValue ID. Examples:

* ID=1 OR ID=2: `{ facetValueFilters: [{ or: [1,2] }] }`
* ID=1 AND ID=2: `{ facetValueFilters: [{ and: 1 }, { and: 2 }] }`
* ID=1 AND (ID=2 OR ID=3): `{ facetValueFilters: [{ and: 1 }, { or: [2,3] }] }`

types.name: Success
types.description: Indicates that an operation succeeded, where we do not want to return any more specific information.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Any optional metadata returned by the ShippingCalculator in the ShippingCalculationResult

types.name: CurrencyCode
DateTimeCustomFieldConfig
types.description:
Expects the same validation formats as the `<input type="datetime-local">` HTML element.
See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/datetime-local#Additional_attributes

inputFields.name: take

inputFields.description: Skips the first n results, for use in pagination

inputFields.name: take

inputFields.name: sort

types.name: LanguageCode

fields.name: orderPlacedAt
fields.description:
The date & time that the Order was placed, i.e. the Customer
completed the checkout and the Order is no longer "active"

fields.name: code
fields.description: A unique code for the Order

fields.name: active
fields.description: An order is active as long as the payment process has not been completed

fields.name: surcharges
fields.description:
Surcharges are arbitrary modifications to the Order total which are neither
ProductVariants nor discounts resulting from applied Promotions. For example,
one-off discounts based on customer interaction, or surcharges based on payment
methods.

fields.name: couponCodes
fields.description: An array of all coupon codes applied to the Order

fields.name: promotions
fields.description: Promotions applied to the order. Only gets populated after the payment process has completed.

fields.name: subTotal
fields.description:
The subTotal is the total of all OrderLines in the Order. This figure also includes any Order-level
discounts which have been prorated (proportionally distributed) amongst the OrderItems.
To get a total of all OrderLines which does not account for prorated discounts, use the
sum of `OrderLine.discountedLinePrice` values.

fields.name: subTotalWithTax
fields.description: Same as subTotal, but inclusive of tax

fields.name: total
fields.description: Equal to subTotal plus shipping

fields.name: totalWithTax
fields.description: The final payable amount. Equal to subTotalWithTax plus shippingWithTax

fields.name: taxSummary
fields.description: A summary of the taxes being applied to this Order

types.name: OrderTaxSummary
types.description:
A summary of the taxes being applied to this order, grouped
by taxRate.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of this tax

fields.name: taxRate
fields.description: The taxRate as a percentage

fields.name: taxBase
fields.description: The total net price or OrderItems to which this taxRate applies

fields.name: taxTotal
fields.description: The total tax being applied to the Order at this taxRate

fields.name: unitPrice
fields.description: The price of a single unit, excluding tax and discounts

fields.name: unitPriceWithTax
fields.description: The price of a single unit, including tax but excluding discounts

fields.name: discountedUnitPrice
fields.description:
The price of a single unit including discounts, excluding tax.

If Order-level discounts have been applied, this will not be the
actual taxable unit price (see `proratedUnitPrice`), but is generally the
correct price to display to customers to avoid confusion
about the internal handling of distributed Order-level discounts.

fields.name: discountedUnitPriceWithTax
fields.description: The price of a single unit including discounts and tax

fields.name: proratedUnitPrice
fields.description:
The actual unit price, taking into account both item discounts _and_ prorated (proportionally-distributed)
Order-level discounts. This value is the true economic value of the OrderItem, and is used in tax
and refund calculations.

fields.name: proratedUnitPriceWithTax
fields.description: The proratedUnitPrice including tax

fields.name: unitPrice
fields.description: The price of a single unit, excluding tax and discounts

fields.name: unitPriceWithTax
fields.description: The price of a single unit, including tax but excluding discounts

fields.name: unitPriceChangeSinceAdded
fields.description: Non-zero if the unitPrice has changed since it was initially added to Order

fields.name: unitPriceWithTaxChangeSinceAdded
fields.description: Non-zero if the unitPriceWithTax has changed since it was initially added to Order

fields.name: discountedUnitPrice
fields.description:
The price of a single unit including discounts, excluding tax.

If Order-level discounts have been applied, this will not be the
actual taxable unit price (see `proratedUnitPrice`), but is generally the
correct price to display to customers to avoid confusion
about the internal handling of distributed Order-level discounts.

fields.name: discountedUnitPriceWithTax
fields.description: The price of a single unit including discounts and tax

fields.name: proratedUnitPrice
fields.description:
The actual unit price, taking into account both item discounts _and_ prorated (proportionally-distributed)
Order-level discounts. This value is the true economic value of the OrderItem, and is used in tax
and refund calculations.

fields.name: proratedUnitPriceWithTax
fields.description: The proratedUnitPrice including tax

fields.name: linePrice
fields.description: The total price of the line excluding tax and discounts.

fields.name: linePriceWithTax
fields.description: The total price of the line including tax but excluding discounts.

fields.name: discountedLinePrice
fields.description: The price of the line including discounts, excluding tax

fields.name: discountedLinePriceWithTax
fields.description: The price of the line including discounts and tax

fields.name: proratedLinePrice
fields.description:
The actual line price, taking into account both item discounts _and_ prorated (proportionally-distributed)
Order-level discounts. This value is the true economic value of the OrderLine, and is used in tax
and refund calculations.

fields.name: proratedLinePriceWithTax
fields.description: The proratedLinePrice including tax

fields.name: lineTax
fields.description: The total tax on this line

types.name: FacetValueResult
types.description:
Which FacetValues are present in the products returned
by the search, and in what quantity.

types.name: CollectionResult
types.description:
Which Collections are present in the products returned
by the search, and in what quantity.

fields.name: collectionIds
fields.description: An array of ids of the Collections in which this result appears

fields.name: score
fields.description: A relevance score for the result. Differs between database implementations

types.name: SearchResultPrice
types.description: The price of a search result product, either as a range or as a single price

types.name: SinglePrice
types.description: The price value where the result has a single price

types.name: PriceRange
types.description: The price range where the result has more than one price

fields.name: variants
fields.description: Returns all ProductVariants

fields.name: variantList
fields.description: Returns a paginated, sortable, filterable list of ProductVariants

types.name: OrderModificationError
types.description: Returned when attempting to modify the contents of an Order that is not in the `AddingItems` state.

types.name: IneligibleShippingMethodError
types.description: Returned when attempting to set a ShippingMethod for which the Order is not eligible

types.name: OrderPaymentStateError
types.description: Returned when attempting to add a Payment to an Order that is not in the `ArrangingPayment` state.

types.name: IneligiblePaymentMethodError
types.description: Returned when attempting to add a Payment using a PaymentMethod for which the Order is not eligible.

types.name: PaymentFailedError
types.description: Returned when a Payment fails due to an error.

types.name: PaymentDeclinedError
types.description: Returned when a Payment is declined by the payment provider.

types.name: AlreadyLoggedInError
types.description: Returned when attempting to set the Customer for an Order when already logged in.

types.name: MissingPasswordError
types.description: Returned when attempting to register or verify a customer account without a password, when one is required.

types.name: PasswordValidationError
types.description: Returned when attempting to register or verify a customer account where the given password fails password validation.

types.name: PasswordAlreadySetError
types.description: Returned when attempting to verify a customer account with a password, when a password has already been set.

types.name: VerificationTokenInvalidError
types.description:
Returned if the verification token (used to verify a Customer's email address) is either
invalid or does not match any expected tokens.

types.name: VerificationTokenExpiredError
types.description:
Returned if the verification token (used to verify a Customer's email address) is valid, but has
expired according to the `verificationTokenDuration` setting in the AuthOptions.

types.name: IdentifierChangeTokenInvalidError
types.description:
Returned if the token used to change a Customer's email address is either
invalid or does not match any expected tokens.

types.name: IdentifierChangeTokenExpiredError
types.description:
Returned if the token used to change a Customer's email address is valid, but has
expired according to the `verificationTokenDuration` setting in the AuthOptions.

types.name: PasswordResetTokenInvalidError
types.description:
Returned if the token used to reset a Customer's password is either
invalid or does not match any expected tokens.

types.name: PasswordResetTokenExpiredError
types.description:
Returned if the token used to reset a Customer's password is valid, but has
expired according to the `verificationTokenDuration` setting in the AuthOptions.

types.name: NotVerifiedError
types.description:
Returned if `authOptions.requireVerification` is set to `true` (which is the default)
and an unverified user attempts to authenticate.

types.name: NoActiveOrderError
types.description:
Returned when invoking a mutation which depends on there being an active Order on the
current session.

types.name: PaymentInput
types.description: Passed as input to the `addPaymentToOrder` mutation.

inputFields.name: method
inputFields.description: This field should correspond to the `code` property of a PaymentMethod.

inputFields.name: metadata
inputFields.description:
This field should contain arbitrary data passed to the specified PaymentMethodHandler's `createPayment()` method
as the "metadata" argument. For example, it could contain an ID for the payment and other
data generated by the payment provider.

inputFields.name: take
inputFields.description: Takes n results, for use in pagination

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description: Specifies which properties to sort the results by

inputFields.name: filter
inputFields.description: Allows the results to be filtered

inputFields.name: filterOperator
inputFields.description: Specifies whether multiple "filter" arguments should be combines with a logical AND or OR operation. Defaults to AND.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
